sen.j: 渡辺 守（わたなべ まもる、慶長15年（1610年） － ？）は江戸時代の人物。
sen.e: Mamoru WATANABE (1610 - year of death unknown) was a figure who lived during the Edo period.
Mamoru WATANABE (1610 - year of death unknown) was a person who lived during the Edo period.
Mamoru WATANABE (1610 - year of death unknown) was a person who lived during the Edo period.
He was a vassal of Tsunashige TOKUGAWA of Kofu Domain.
He was a vassal of Tsunashige TOKUGAWA of Kofu Domain.
He was a vassal of Tsunashige TOKUGAWA of Kofu Domain.
His common name was Gon no hyoe.
He was commonly called Gon no hyoe.
sen.cmt: 「通称」は"be commonly called"に変更しました。
sen.e: He was commonly called Gon no hyoe.

sen.j: 渡辺糺の長男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the fist son of Tadasu WATANABE.
He was born as the fist son of Tadasu WATANABE.
He was born as the fist son of Tadasu WATANABE.

sen.j: 父の糺に連れられて大坂城へ入城する。
sen.e: He went into the Osaka-jo Castle accompanied by his father Tadasu.
He was taken by his father, Tadasu, and entered Osaka-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 「～連れられて」を"taken by…"に変更しました。「入城する」を"entered a castle"に変更しました。
sen.e: He was taken by his father, Tadasu, and entered Osaka-jo Castle.

sen.j: 大坂夏の陣で父は戦死したが、守は大坂城落城の折、乳母の手により城を脱出し京都の南禅寺で出家する。
sen.e: In the Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka), his father died, but Mamoru escaped from the castle thanks to her memoto (wet nurse)'s help when the Osaka-jo Castle fell, and he became a priest at Nanzen-ji Temple.

Although his father died in the Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka), Mamoru escaped from the castle with the help of his wet nurse when the Osaka-jo Castle fell, and he became a priest at Nanzen-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: （戦死した）が、→Although（用語統一リストに従い、howeverでなはく、althoughから始まる文章に変更しました。）「乳母」→his wet nurse（「守の乳母」なので"her"ではなく"his"とし、「乳母」は"wet nurse"とし、ミススペルもあわせて訂正しました。）「～の手により」→with the help of ～（熟語を用いることにより、簡潔な表現になると判断しました。）
sen.e: Although his father died in the Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka), Mamoru escaped from the castle with the help of his wet nurse when the Osaka-jo Castle fell, and he became a priest at Nanzen-ji Temple.

sen.j: 1628年頃細川忠興等の働きがけで還俗する。
sen.e: In 1628, persuaded by Tadaoki HOSOKAWA, he returned to secular life.
In around 1628, he returned to secular life with the encouragement of Tadaoki HOSOKAWA.
sen.cmt: 1628年頃→In around 1628（「頃」が訳抜けでしたので、追加しました。）働きがけで→with the encouragement of（熟語を用いた方がよりわかりやすいと判断し、変更しました。）
sen.e: In around 1628, he returned to secular life with the encouragement of Tadaoki HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: その後徳川綱重に500石で仕えたという。
sen.e: After that, it is said that he served Tsunashige TOKUGAWA with a stipend of 500-koku (139 cubic meters) crop yield.
It is said that he served Tsunashige TOKUGAWA with a stipend of 500-koku (139 cubic meters) crop yield thereafter.
sen.cmt: 初訳ですと、「その後～という」となり、「その後仕えた」と意味が異なるので、「その後」の位置を変更しました。
sen.e: It is said that he served Tsunashige TOKUGAWA with a stipend of 500-koku (139 cubic meters) crop yield thereafter.
